codelist.label: Fault Type
codelist.definition: Terms describing the type of shear displacement structure.
codelist.description: EXAMPLE: thrust fault, normal fault, wrench fault.

extensibility.label: Extensible with values at any level

value.label: fault
value.definition: A discrete surface, or zone of discrete surfaces, with some thickness, separating two rock masses across which one mass has slid past the other.

value.label: extraction fault
value.definition: A fault whose two sides have approached each other substantially in the direction perpendicular to the fault.

value.label: high angle fault
value.definition: Fault that dips at least 45 degrees over more than half of its recognized extent, for which slip or separation is not explicitly specified.

value.label: low angle fault
value.definition: Fault that dips less than 45 degrees over more than half of the recognized extent of the fault.

value.label: oblique slip fault
value.definition: Fault with slip vector that has ratio of strike-parallel to dip-parallel displacement between 10 to 1 and 1 to 10 at at least one location along the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: reverse fault
value.definition: Fault with dip-parallel displacement component of slip vector more than 10 times the strike-parallel component of the slip vector at at least one location along the mapped trace of the fault, and the fault dips consistently in the same direction with the hanging wall displaced up relative to the footwall over at least half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: scissor fault
value.definition: A fault on which there is increasing offset or separation along the strike from an initial point of no offset, with the opposite sense of offset in the opposite direction.

value.label: strike slip fault
value.definition: Fault with strike-parallel displacement component of slip vector more than 10 times the dip-parallel component of the slip vector at at least one location along the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: detachment fault
value.definition: A regional-scale, large displacement, low-angle normal fault.

value.label: dextral strike slip fault
value.definition: Fault with right-lateral strike-parallel displacement component of slip vector more than 10 times the dip-parallel component of the slip vector at at least one location along the fault, and right-lateral displacement over more than half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: high angle reverse
value.definition: Reverse fault that dips at least 45 degrees over more than half of its recognized extent, for which slip or separation is not explicitly specified.

value.label: high-angle normal fault
value.definition: Fault that dips at least 45 degrees over more than half of the recognized extent of the fault with the hanging wall displaced from a structurally higher position relative to footwall rocks.

value.label: horizontal fault
value.definition: Fault that dips less than 10 degrees over more than half the recognized extent of the fault.

value.label: left normal fault
value.definition: High angle fault with slip vector that has ratio of strike-parallel to dip-parallel displacement between 10 to 1 and 1 to 10 at at least one location along the mapped trace, with left-lateral strike-parallel component and normal dip-parallel component over at least half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: left reverse fault
value.definition: High angle fault with slip vector that has ratio of strike-parallel to dip-parallel displacement between 10 to 1 and 1 to 10 at at least one location along the mapped trace, with left-lateral strike-parallel component and reverse dip-parallel component over at least half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: low-angle normal fault
value.definition: Fault that dips less than 45 degrees over more than half of the recognized extent of the fault with the hanging wall displaced from a structurally higher position relative to footwall rocks.

value.label: mixed extraction fault
value.definition: An extraction fault with some displacement within the fault plane.

value.label: normal fault
value.definition: Fault with dip-parallel displacement component of slip vector more than 10 times the strike-parallel component of the slip vector over more than half recognized extent of the fault, and for which the fault dips consistently in the same direction, and for which the hanging wall has been displaced down relative to the footwall.

value.label: pure extraction fault
value.definition: An extraction fault with no discernible displacement within the fault plane.

value.label: right normal fault
value.definition: High angle fault with slip vector that has ratio of strike-parallel to dip-parallel displacement between 10 to 1 and 1 to 10 at at least one location along the mapped trace, with right-lateral strike-parallel component and normal dip-parallel component of slip over at least half the mapped trace of the fault

value.label: right reverse fault
value.definition: High angle fault with slip vector that has ratio of strike-parallel to dip-parallel displacement between 10 to 1 and 1 to 10 at at least one location along the mapped trace, with a right-lateral strike-parallel component and reverse dip-parallel component of slip over at least half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: sinistral strike slip fault
value.definition: Fault with left-lateral strike-parallel displacement component of slip vector more than 10 times the dip-parallel component of the slip vector at at least one location along the fault, and left-lateral displacement over more than half the mapped trace of the fault.

value.label: thrust fault
value.definition: Fault that dips less than 45 degrees over more than half of the recognized extent of the fault, with a hanging wall displaced from a structurally deeper position relative to footwall rocks.

value.label: wrench fault
value.definition: A strike slip fault in which the fault plane dips at least 45 degrees over more than half of the recognized extent of the fault.
